intro: Galvezia glabrata, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Galvezia glabrata is also known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and vegetative reproduction.
